tweet_data.text:
I've been diving into some really interesting corners of Web3 lately  3 projects that stood out today: @MagicNewton, @OpenledgerHQ, and @Humanityprot. All 3 tackling big problems in different ways. Here‚Äôs the quick rundown üßµ

1/ MagicNewton
This one's building the AI-native infra layer for crypto...Basically, onchain agents that can think, learn, and evolve.
It feels like the future of DePIN, autonomous trading, and even governance. Wild stuff I know!

2/ OpenLedgerHQ
Super cool concept that lets you build your own AI models (no heavy coding needed), using verified data.
Imagine spinning up a custom assistant that filters airdrops, analyzes NFTs, or helps with DAO ops. That‚Äôs the vibe

3/ Humanity Protocol
This one‚Äôs all about digital identity, but done right.  palm-based biometrics + zero-knowledge proofs.
No KYC hell, just Sybil resistance and privacy preserved. Built on Polygon CDK, so it‚Äôs made to scale.

Honestly, all 3 are working on different pieces of a more intelligent, trustworthy Web3.
It‚Äôs not just hype, the tools are finally catching up to the vision.

Which one would you build with? üîç
